summary: This is an email chain from July 31, 2019, discussing a significant logjam in attorney visits at the Special Housing Unit (SHU) of a detention facility. The primary issue is that Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys were allegedly allowed to hold a conference room for extended periods, including while he was taken to medical, while other attorneys had to wait for hours and sometimes could not see their clients at all. One attorney mentions the intent to file something with Judge Rakoff regarding a client named Sayoc.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: He is the inmate whose attorneys are reportedly receiving preferential treatment by being allowed to hold onto the SHU attorney conference room while he is taken to medical or other locations, causing a logjam for other attorneys.

persons.name: Judge Rakoff
persons.context: Mentioned as the judge before whom an attorney intends to file something regarding a client named Sayoc, due to the inability to meet with that client because of the visiting logjam.

persons.name: Sayoc
persons.context: An inmate with an upcoming sentencing. An attorney states they have not been able to meet with him due to the visiting logjam and may file something with Judge Rakoff.

connections.description: Judge Rakoff is a federal judge mentioned in the context of legal filings. While not directly stated as presiding over Epstein's case here, the email discusses general legal procedures and potential filings before him.

events.title: Attorney Visiting Logjam at SHU
events.description: On July 30, 2019, staff observed that Jeffrey Epstein's lawyers were allowed to hold onto the SHU attorney conference room even after meeting with him and while he was taken to medical, a privilege not extended to other attorneys. This caused extreme delays, with one attorney waiting 2.5 hours and giving up, and another waiting 3 hours.

events.title: Email Chain Regarding SHU Visiting Issue
events.description: An email is forwarded on July 31, 2019, summarizing the attorney visiting logjam issue from the previous day and expressing urgent need for a solution, noting the intent to potentially file with Judge Rakoff.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys were allegedly given preferential treatment in the SHU by being allowed to hold a conference room indefinitely while he was taken to medical, while other attorneys had to leave and get back in line.
The logjam caused severe delays: one attorney waited 2.5 hours and gave up, another waited 3 hours total, including 75 minutes after reaching the SHU room while Epstein was brought back from medical.
An attorney for another inmate, Sayoc, who has an upcoming sentencing, was unable to meet with their client due to this issue and threatened to file something with Judge Rakoff.
The email chain is marked 'CONFIDENTIAL' and is part of the SDNY document set (SDNY_00010697, SDNY_00010698).
